::Zardus::

Zardus frowns, listening to Lady Hawk. He glances at Najah. "Torture 
never gives the best results, Najah."

He looks back at Lady Hawk. If Squizzy could replicate the 
experiments, then Lady Hawk would obvioustly not be needed. A bot was 
always useful, yes, but not one that would run away first chance he 
or she got, and Zardus had a feeling that Lady Hawk would do just 
that.

"Hmm.. Squizzy denied of wanting to copy your experiments, and since 
I know the programming that is running through her head, I am fairly 
sure I can believe her. This ship has many labs, I can allow you to 
work at one, away from Squizzy. But you would be well guarded by the 
ship."







--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Lady Hawk frowned, obviously Squizzy had denied wanting credit for 
her
> experiments. "I attacked the mongoose because I thought she had 
intentions
> on my experiments." An echo filled her head as she could have sworn 
that
> she'd used this argument before. "She is the only one who 
understood them
> and the only one capable of stealing them, If she took over then 
you'd no
> longer have use for me." Lady Hawk smiled a wicked smile in the 
crack of her
> beak, "I know what happens to bots that have worn out thier use."
